com.b2international.commons.db

Class PreparedUpdateExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.b2international.commons.db.PreparedUpdateExecutor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PreparedBatchedUpdateExecutor

    public class PreparedUpdateExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows the client to issue multiple updates to the database with the same prepared statement instance. Operations (including the constructor) may throw RuntimeSQLException to indicate failure related to the database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PreparedUpdateExecutor(java.sql.Connection connection, java.lang.String sql)
      Creates a new prepared statement executor instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Releases resources associated with the contained prepared statement.
      static void close(PreparedUpdateExecutor executor)
      Closes the specified query executor.
      void commit()
      Makes the changes carried out by this executor permanent by committing the active transaction of the database connection.
      protected void doExecute(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
      Hook method for carrying out the actual update on the statement populated with actual parameters.
      void execute(java.lang.Object... parameters)
      Executes an update with the specified parameters, using the Java object to database column type conversion defined by the JDBC API.
      int getExecuteCount()
      Returns the number of execute(Object...) calls since the last commit.
      protected void preCommit(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
      Hook method for performing pre-commit operations on the prepared statement before committing the connection's active transaction.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PreparedUpdateExecutor

        public PreparedUpdateExecutor(java.sql.Connection connection,
                              java.lang.String sql)
        Creates a new prepared statement executor instance.
        Parameters:
        connection - the database connection to use
        sql - the SQL statement, with zero or more '?' placeholders

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public static void close(PreparedUpdateExecutor executor)
        Closes the specified query executor.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to close (may be null or an already closed instance)

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Executes an update with the specified parameters, using the Java object to database column type conversion defined by the JDBC API. Depending on the implementation used, the results of an update may not be visible even in the same transaction until commit() is called.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the variable number of parameters for the prepared statement

      • doExecute

        protected void doExecute(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Hook method for carrying out the actual update on the statement populated with actual parameters. The default implementation calls PreparedStatement.executeUpdate() on the given statement; subclasses may override.
        Parameters:
        statement - the prepared statement associated with this executor
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the statement is closed or a database error occurs

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Makes the changes carried out by this executor permanent by committing the active transaction of the database connection.

      • preCommit

        protected void preCommit(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Hook method for performing pre-commit operations on the prepared statement before committing the connection's active transaction. The default implementation is empty; subclasses should override.
        Parameters:
        statement - the prepared statement associated with this executor
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the statement is closed or a database error occurs

      • close

        public void close()
        Releases resources associated with the contained prepared statement.

      • getExecuteCount

        public int getExecuteCount()
        Returns the number of execute(Object...) calls since the last commit.
        Returns:
        the execution count
